thread.title: California man drives Hummer into hotel room
thread.title_full: California man drives Hummer into hotel room - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: California man drives Hummer into hotel room
text:
KABC Richard Melendez repeatedly drove his Hummer into the side of a hotel. KABC Thankfully no one was injured and Melendez was arrested. KABC Melendez may have been drunk at the time of the incident. Previous Next Enlarge It was a strange way to say hello.
A California man repeatedly rammed his Hummer into the wall of a hotel as he apparently tried to reach the room where family members were staying, cops said.
Initially, Richard Melendez was causing a smaller disruption by banging on the door of his mother's and sister's room at 1 a.m. Friday morning at the Extended Stay America hotel in San Dimas, KTLA reported .
Los Angeles County Sheriffâ€™s Department Melendez slammed into the building 6-10 times. When authorities arrived, the 28-year-old Melendez had vanished, but he returned later and drove his Hummer into the wall of the hotel 6-10 times, according to the station.
Melendez stopped after the Hummer partially entered the hotel room. Thankfully, his wife and four young children were sleeping across the hall, KTLA reported.
Witnesses told police that Melendez was drunk and had a gun, but no weapon was found at the scene, the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department told KTLA.
No one was injured, but several people in the hotel were evacuated, the station reported.
Witnesses told ABC that Melendez may have been upset about gambling losses.
"Supposedly he lost all his money, lost the house and everything, so that might have contributed to what happened," Mark Kuszewski told the station.
Melendez was booked on suspicion of assault with a deadly weapon.
dboroff@nydailynews.com
